729603f-a.text:
St. Pauls Avenue, adjoining the N. W. corner of Paxton (Church) Street, showing the old St. Pauls (P.E.) Memorial Church. The building was erected in 1834. A new brick edifice was erected in 18o6 at the S. E. corner of St. Pauls avenue and Clinton Street, and the old structure
abandoned.
187O's (7)
Copy from photorraph by J. Loeffler
From P. L. Sperr Collection
729603f-a.folder: St. Pauls Avenue & Paxton Street, Staten Island, NY
729603f-a.original_title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Paxton Street

729600f-b.text:
(1)
225 St. Pauls Avenue, south of the S.E. corner of Clinton Street, showing St. Pauls Protestant Episcopal Wemorial Church.
The building was erected in 1868.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The parsonage of St. Pauls Memorial Church, adjoining the
church to the south.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
